image.altText: Two workers on the side of a steep mountain picking coca leaves off coca plants

items.synopsis: Follow the path cocaine takes from Colombian bush labs to your local suburbs — and the battle to intercept it.

title.children: Cocaine is everywhere in Australia. Here's why

image.altText: Yevgeny Prigozhin shakes hands with someone and smiles as he leaves the headquarters of the Southern Military District in a car

items.synopsis: The boss of the Wagner mercenaries has aborted his bid to topple Russia's military leaders. Here's what we know about the deal brokered with Yevgeny Prigozhin and what the fallout from the mutiny might mean for Vladimir Putin.

title.children: What happened during the Wagner Group mutiny — and what comes next? Here's what we know

image.altText: A close-up of a corporate pwc logo on a reflective glass building panel.

items.synopsis: Troubled consultancy firm PwC Australia confirms it will sell off its government business as it tries to stem the fallout from a massive tax leak scandal.

title.children: PwC appoints new CEO and announces it will sell off government business for $1

image.altText: A procession of walkers on a beach in the early morning

items.synopsis: The Noosa community gathered on Sunday morning to pay tribute to 87-year-old local John Kerr, who died after being violently attacked on a morning walk last week.

title.children: Noosa community walks against fear after 87yo killed on morning walk

image.altText: Pedestrian walks past Reserve Bank building in Sydney

items.synopsis: The Reserve Bank says it needs unemployment to rise to bring inflation down, and we should welcome their plain speaking, writes Gareth Hutchens.

title.children: The Reserve Bank wants more unemployment. It should be applauded for admitting it

image.altText: A young woman with long blonde hair, standing near a waterway smiling.

items.synopsis: Meningococcal B is a rare but deadly disease that is not covered by the National Immunisation Program. The parents of a young woman who died from it last year are trying to change that.

title.children: 'One death is too many' as parents of meningococcal victim issue vaccine plea for festivals and schoolies

image.altText: A closeup headshot of Julian Sands looking at the camera with messy hair and a black jacket and white collar

items.synopsis: Hikers find remains of a human body in a Southern Californian mountain area where British-born actor Julian Sands went missing in January, having set off on his own hike in the region east of Los Angeles.

title.children: Human remains found where actor Julian Sands disappeared five months ago

image.altText: A portrait of Mandy looking into the camera. Her van is behind her. The back is open. Many items are inside.

items.synopsis: The rise in homelessness is easy to see across Australia, with more rough sleepers on streets and tent cities in parks. But there's a group experiencing homelessness who prefer to go unnoticed — the growing number of people living in vehicles.

title.children: 'Van life' is glamorised on social media. Here's the reality for one woman whose car is now home

image.altText: A woman wearing a jacket smiling

items.synopsis: Alison Howes is part of the growing number of Australians setting up clothing exchanges, helping people cut costs as well as reducing waste.

title.children: What's old is new again with clothing exchanges back in vogue as families look to stretch budgets

image.altText: Young mastiff

items.synopsis: Queensland authorities want to get tough on owners of dangerous dogs with new laws that could see them jailed. The state could also become the first to completely ban some breeds.

title.children: Queensland could be the first state with a total ban on certain dog breeds

image.altText: Rainbow storytime supporters rallying outside the Thirroul library

items.synopsis: A community in the New South Wales Illawarra has turned out to voice support for a Rainbow Storytime event despite protests from far-right groups.

title.children: Residents rally in support of LGBTQI+ community amid right-wing protests at drag queen reading event

image.altText: A ball-carrier in the NRL keeps low and bursts forward past a defender during a game.

items.synopsis: The Rabbitohs take on the Cowboys before the Roosters host the Raiders, while the Titans celebrate a shock win over the Broncos. Follow our ScoreCentre for all the live scores and stats.

title.children: NRL live: Rabbitohs take on Cowboys after Titans upset Broncos

image.altText: A Gold Coast Suns player runs through the midfield carrying the ball and looking upfield, trailed by teammates and a defender.

items.synopsis: Collingwood leave it late again, coming from behind in the last to beat Adelaide in a cracker at the MCG. Meanwhile the Suns host the Hawks at Carrara. Follow our live AFL ScoreCentre for all the scores, stats and results.

title.children: AFL live: Suns take on Hawks after Pies edge Crows in MCG thriller

image.altText: A composite image of two Facebook ads, run by the Yes and No Voice campaigns.

items.synopsis: Both sides of the Voice to Parliament referendum campaign are starting to spend big on social media advertising, and where they’re directing their dollars gives us some clues about their strategies, writes Casey Briggs.

title.children: The Voice No campaign has spied a path to victory, and it hangs on Australia's smallest states

image.altText: Silhouetted figure of a woman to the left, farm gate to the right. Sunset in the centre

items.synopsis: The ABC can reveal there is a court battle to keep a man who abducted and raped a German backpacker 10 years ago behind bars, with forensic psychiatrists fearing he was a high risk of reoffending.

title.children: A German backpacker responded to an ad to nanny in remote Queensland. It was a sex offender's trap

image.altText: A man stands beside a broken-down vehicle with a big yellow sign on the side saying 'help' in black letters.

items.synopsis: Australia's stunning landscapes can be perilous for the unprepared. Two outdoor experts and an intrepid hiker give their tips for surviving in the alps, the outback and the tropics.

title.children: Why a 'MacGyver kit' could stop a camping emergency from becoming a tragedy

image.altText: Nick Kyrgios gives side-eye while wearing all black at a press conference.

items.synopsis: 2022 Wimbledon finalist Nick Kyrgios has pulled out of another grass-court warm-up event, leaving his prospects of a big run at the grand slam looking bleak.

title.children: Wimbledon fears for Nick Kyrgios after Mallorca withdrawal

image.altText: An Australian tennis player leans back ready to punch the air in celebration after winning a match in London.

items.synopsis: Alex de Minaur enjoys one of the best wins of his career to forge into the final of the prestigious Queen's Club Championship in London.

title.children: Alex De Minaur powers into Queen's Club Championship final, will face Carlos Alcaraz for title

image.altText: Creekbed and road overflowing with water outside a house

items.synopsis: A rainband stretching more than 3,000 kilometres will engulf Australia next week, delivering soaking rains from the Pilbara and Kimberley, across the outback to the eastern seaboard.

title.children: Week-long drenching forecast across Australia as El Niño takes a rain check

image.altText: A dam surrounded by grass with trees in the background

items.synopsis: Severe weather continues in South Australia today, with the State Emergency Service issuing watch and act messages for two dams at high risk of failure at Basket Range and Hope Forest.

title.children: Warnings for two dams at high risk of failure, as severe weather continues across South Australia

image.altText: An aerial shot of a development plan for Little Bay near the coast in NSW

items.synopsis: The email exchange between Harry Triguboff and senior New South Wales government figures provides a glimpse into the tactics the billionaire used to try and rezone an area around Little Bay.

title.children: Emails show how billionaire tried to fast-track rezoning of Sydney precinct as angry locals fight plans

image.altText: A woman standing outside holding a black and white cat that is wearing a bib.

items.synopsis: Experts say roaming pet cats are killings millions of native wildlife annually but there is a tool to help mitigate this.

title.children: Cat bibs are being trialled to stop pets killing wildlife, but keeping cats indoors is still best

image.altText: Photo of wagyu flock next to photo of hemp crop.

items.synopsis: A farming family is feeding their livestock hemp-based pellets, testing impacts on health and meat quality.

title.children: Farmers trial hemp feed for cattle, marron to see if it boosts healthy omegas in the meat

items.synopsis: An intense herd rebuild has left Australia with more cattle for market, and graziers and consumers alike are set to benefit.

title.children: Cheaper steaks on the way as more meat heads to market

image.altText: A bridge is collapsed over a river with items layered ontop each other in the river. It looks like a rural area.

items.synopsis: Officials shut down drinking water intakes downstream due to the "potential hazmat spill" while they evaluate the danger of the accident.

title.children: Freight train carrying hazardous materials plunges into Yellowstone River

image.altText: A woman wearing a grey shirt looks directly to camera

items.synopsis: In the 12 months since the US Supreme Court overturned the law enshrining abortion rights nationwide, the landscape has drastically changed. Abortion is now prohibited or heavily restricted for millions of Americans, and providers are worried their most vulnerable patients will continue to suffer.

title.children: After Roe fell, Anya Cook ended up miscarrying her unviable pregnancy in a hair salon bathroom

image.altText: Woman wearing a patterned blue dress and red glasses smiles, with her hands together. Tropical trees are in the background.

items.synopsis: As international students struggle to find accommodation, more Australians than ever before are renting out their spare bedrooms — and it's helping pay the bills.

title.children: 'If you've got a spare bedroom, you can turn it into tax-free income': More Australians hosting international students

image.altText: Nick Margan sits with an elderly woman, the pair clap along together

items.synopsis: It's not often you see a 27-year-old visiting an aged care facility, but Nick's "compassionate heart" and musical abilities bring immeasurable joy to elderly residents.

title.children: 'Marvellous' Nick Margan can't contain his joy when singing and dancing, and the good vibes are infectious

image.altText: a picture of one of the Bays on Magnetic Island and surrounding rainforest

items.synopsis: The 26-year-old tourist had celebrated her birthday just last week, according to her employer.

title.children: 'She was a great friend': Belgian tourist dies after motor-scooter crash on island off Queensland coast

image.altText: A swimmer in the ocean looks out at a large opening in a rock wall.

items.synopsis: Attracting more than a million visitors each year, the Kiama Blowhole is the biggest in the world but most only see it from the top. Ex-navy officer and ocean swimmer Scott Gutterson heads underneath to document what it's like inside the blowhole's chamber.

title.children: Inside Kiama Blowhole's secret underground chamber

image.altText: A large crocodile resting in the sun on a muddy bank

items.synopsis: A local clean-up group says it is prohibited from removing unmarked pots due to regulations. The matter has come to a head again after a juvenile crocodile was found dead in an unmarked crab pot on the bank of a river in north Queensland.

title.children: Community frustrated after juvenile crocodile drowns while caught in old fishing pot

image.altText: A wasp on a tree.

items.synopsis: Scientists find a new biocontrol measure to fight the destructive Sirex wasp, that attacks the softwood pine trees we rely on to build our homes and furniture.

title.children: Parasitic roundworm discovery boosts biological battle against tree-killing wasp

image.altText: Three women in Edwardian dress posing by a waterfall.

items.synopsis: Modern-day adventurers step back in time to recreate the hiking experiences of a pair of  Tasmanian pioneering conservationists who campaigned for the protection of Cradle Mountain.

title.children: 'We get a lot of Picnic at Hanging Rock references': The Tasmanian bushwalkers who dress like it's the early 1900s

image.altText: Security personnel keep watch outside the Wuhan Institute of Virology during the visit by the World Health Organisation.

items.synopsis: US intelligence report on COVID-19 origins rejects some points raised by lab leak theory proponents.

title.children: No direct evidence COVID started in Wuhan lab, US report finds

image.altText: A blonde white woman wearing a white and black striped singlet sits in a warmly-lit bar swilling a cocktail.

items.synopsis: After a two-year hiatus from screen acting, Lawrence is back with her characteristic blend of goof and charm in this delicious comedy inspired by a bonkers real-life dating-meets-job ad.

title.children: Jennifer Lawrence latest movie proves that the sex comedy of 2023 is a very different beast
